author: out.eth
content: if the withdrawal address is set to proxy A smart contract then will this be a valid withdrawal request? `proxy A -> logic contract B -> eth 2 withdrawal contract` or will the withdrawal verification fail fail?

author: m.kalinin
content: The way it's currently designed it could be any chain of calls leading up to `system withdrawal contract`, as long as withdrawal receipt is valid and hasn't been wasted previously, the balance will be withdrawn to `proxy A` contract address.

author: out.eth
content: <@!425572898787426305> Ok I think I misread what <@!291925846556540928> said. So right now only the the "active bls key" can exit validation - is "active bls key" the validator public key here? And in the future will the eth1 keys be able to initiate exiting?

author: out.eth
content: And if the eth1 key can initiate exiting then will this be a valid way to exit for Proxy A? `proxy A -> logic contract B -> eth 2 exiting contract`

author: m.kalinin
content: Exit message must be signed by validator's public key and there is no future plans on changing it, i.e. eth1 keys won't be able to initiate exits

author: pawandhananjay
content:
Hello, just wanted to clarify the changes introduced in this PR https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/2475
when it says `if topic in phase0_topics: return phase0_msg_id_fn(message) else return altair_msg_id_fn(message)`
does `phase0_topics` here mean topics that have the phase 0 fork digest or is it something else?

author: protolambda
content: yes, topic names that were previously used for phase0, the fork-digest is part of that

author: protolambda
content: We basically just need to avoid a situation where messages have two different *message IDs, so we stick to the old ID function for phase0. Those topics are being rotated out anyway, so eventually it won't be necessary anymore.

author: pawandhananjay
content: so `/eth2/<altair-fork-digest>/<any-valid-topic>` uses the `altair_message_id_fn`?

author: protolambda
content: yes

author: pawandhananjay
content: got it, thanks üëç

author: out.eth
content: What happens if you make 2 deposits with different withdrawal credentials but using same validator public key?

author: protolambda
content:
See `process_deposit` in the phase0 beacon spec: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#deposits
What happens with the 2nd deposit is that the deposit tops up the validator balance that corresponds to the validator pubkey, the withdrawal credential in the deposit is ignored.
